 SilentPoet:
 "The Brain in the vat : Idea - Mad scientists are able to get a brain into a machine in which they trick the brain into thinking it has a body and is a real person. This is idea in a way resembles the Matrix. Is it possible for them to do this.
 (so that the "brain" could move freely around this world)?"
 
 - The idea is to trick the brain into thinking it is still alive within a normal human body in a 3d world. This includes fingers. Once any body part, (such as arms, fingers, toes,) are included with this body and a material is put in (which must exist for it to be a real world) (ex. sand) The impulses must be ready to calculate this toe going through the sand at the exact second it does so. The possiblities are completely endless and the impulses would never be ready nor able to be comtemplated ahead of time. 
 
 Thanks for reading this
 
 Always Stay Open Minded

Plus it could be made as a holding area for people until physical immortality is achieved at which time they are pulled out of the virtual heaven and given new physical bodies. This is an awefully silly post. However, it is nonetheless an excellent source of logic.
 
 The brain can do nothing without the senses. It is incapable of processing anything without having anything to process. Kind of makes sense. If your brains are all in a vat and are reset, they are incapable of thinking anything without new instructions from either your senses or electrical stimulations from whatever machine I have you hooked up to.
 
 Further more, this is kind of a proving point for evolution. How all complexity in nature had to have began with a very simple organism capable of very few functions. Such as Paramecium. They exist for the three simplist existable purposes. To sense energy, eat, and reproduce. I don't think your complex brains could ever conceive or be capable of existing with such simplicity. Therefore, If I reset your brains, you shouldn't be able to think at all.
 
 
 ;)
